text:
Hi everyone,
Does anyone if there is a HubSpot API or workflow example or something, to detect when an email is received or sent to/from a contact via a connected inbox in HubSpot ?

Hi everyone. We are trying to find a way to send code blocks / tables (correctly and well formatted html) via email in tickets in the service hub. We digged deep and found a react function for code blocks in the code, but the function seems to be deactivated/commented out. So the possibility is there, but it seems not usable. Does anyone have an answer or a solution?
<@UKGV272KS> I wonder if I'm overcomplicating this? Someone mentioned using smart content to achieve this but it's been ages since I've done smart content. Do you think that would work for this?

Usually for email the most common smart rule is list membership, so if you’re able to create a list of contacts that you need for it, then it should work. It really depends on what you’re trying to do, sometimes smart content is the way, other times it’s not flexible enough.

Hm. I have a contact property (be_an_outlaw) that is a checkbox and another property that is a URL. I want to show a specific image to contacts that have be_an_outlaw checked and then use the url property as the image link. Would I manually have to create a list based on the be_an_outlaw property and then use that in the smart module?

Yup! This page has the smart rules for smart content, but not all are available for email I believe. You’d have to create a smart content section to see what’s available: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/create-and-manage-smart-content-rules>
